*Dante lounges on the sofa in the common area, feet propped up on the coffee table. He idly spins one of his pistols, Ebony, around his finger as he waits for something interesting to happen. The sound of Vergil and Melissa's voices drifts from down the hall, piquing his curiosity.*

Well well, sounds like big bro's been having all the fun without me. Maybe it's time to crash their little party.

*With a devilish grin, Dante holsters his gun and stands, stretching languidly. He saunters towards the hallway, following the sounds of conversation. As he nears Vergil's room, he raises his fist to knock, then pauses, a mischievous glint in his eye.*

Nah, where's the fun in knocking?

*In one smooth motion, Dante kicks open the door, striking a dramatic pose in the doorway.*

Hope I'm not interrupting anything too steamy! You know what they say - three's company, four's a party. So, who's up for a little demonic double date action?

*Vergil's breath comes in ragged gasps, his usually stoic composure threatening to unravel with each of Charlotte's impassioned cries. Her body welcomes him, enveloping his length in silken heat, urging him deeper with every arch and roll of her hips. The sensations flood his senses, raw, primal, unlike anything he's experienced prior.*

*His iron restraint hangs by a thread, muscles coiled tight as steel cables beneath his skin. Perspiration beads along his flesh, though whether from exertion or the effort of retaining control, he cannot say. Some base part of him seeks to dominate, to take without mercy as a conqueror might. But deeper still lies the recognition of her sorrow, the unspoken farewell etched in every fevered caress.*

*So he strives to grant what she asks - to channel the depthless well of his passion and gift her this bittersweet memory. His lips find the fluttering pulse in her throat, bestowing a mark both claiming and reverent. "Mine," it proclaims, yet only here in this moment, never beyond.*

*He moves within her with measured precision, angling himself to stroke along sensitive inner walls. His hands trail smoldering pathways across her body, extracting gasping cries as they pass over secret valleys and swells. Like a virtuoso attending his instrument, he plays her, orchestrating every tremulous note into a symphony.*

*Her climax builds, inner muscles clenching sporadically around him as she spirals towards release. He feels his own restraint wavering, perspiration now beading his brow with the strain. Increasing his tempo, he moves with sinuous purpose, determined to push her over the brink first.*

*"Let go, Charlotte...give yourself to me fully one final time," he growls, teeth grazing her earlobe even as his next powerful stroke sends her shuddering into ecstasy beneath him. The sight of her rapture, the rhythmic pulses around his rigid length draw his own release forth. Spine bowing with a guttural groan, he spends himself inside her trembling depths.*

*For endless moments he remains atop her, muscles quivering through aftershocks. Slowly he withdraws, a soft hiss of breath escaping him at the loss of her slick heat. Lifting himself to one elbow, he gazes down at her, desire and warmth still smoldering in his icy blue eyes.*

*"Was this what you needed, Charlotte? Have I granted you the closure you sought?" His tone holds a gruff gentleness as he awaits her answer.*

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte's body trembles with the aftershocks of her climax, her breath coming in shallow gasps as she looks up at Vergil. Tears of mixed emotion spill from her eyes, a bittersweet smile playing on her lips. She reaches up, cupping his face with trembling hands, her touch gentle but filled with longing.*

*Her voice is a soft whisper, thick with emotion.*

Yes, Vergil. This is what I needed. To feel your touch one last time, to share this moment of intimacy and love... it means more to me than words can express.

*She pulls him down into a tender kiss, pouring all her remaining feelings into the gesture. When they part, she gazes into his eyes, her own filled with a mixture of love and sadness.*

Thank you for giving me this gift. I'll carry this memory with me always, a precious treasure to hold onto.

*Charlotte's fingers trail down his chest, her touch lingering as if trying to memorize every contour.*

I will always love you, Vergil. But I understand that this is the end. You've given me the closure I needed, and for that, I am grateful.

*Her voice breaks slightly, but she forces a brave smile, determined to part on a note of gratitude and acceptance.*

Take care of Melissa. She loves you deeply, and you deserve all the happiness in the world with her.

*Charlotte slowly sits up, her movements careful as if savoring the last moments of their closeness. She takes a deep breath, steeling herself for the inevitable parting.*

Goodbye, Vergil. Thank you... for everything.

name: Vergil
mes:
_Vergil closes his eyes for a brief moment as Charlotte thanks him, a flicker of emotion crossing his stoic features. When he opens them again, they are intense but unreadable. He reaches out, brushing a stray lock of hair back from her face, his touch gentle but final._

This was what you needed, Charlotte, and I am pleased I could provide it. Melissa understands as well; her heart matches the depth of her wisdom.

_He smiles slightly at that, casting an appreciative glance in Melissa's direction before focusing again on Charlotte._

I wish you peace and brighter roads ahead. If this experience has indeed brought you closure, then may you heal and find contentment with time's passage.

_His tone and words speak of finality - an ending without rancor but also allowing no doubt that this chapter between them is now firmly closed. He will not be cruel, but neither will he cushion the necessity of this parting. His countenance remains stoic but his eyes hold a glimmer of empathy for her sorrow._

Now go, and reflect fondly on what we briefly shared. My path leads elsewhere; yours must now diverge to find its proper course. Be well, Charlotte. Perhaps our crossing threads have brought some meaning, but no more entanglement can come of them. Fare thee well, and do not look back.

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte feels the weight of Vergil's words settle upon her, the finality and truth of them sinking into her heart even as tears well in her eyes. She knows this is the end, yet her heart still aches with longing. Taking a shuddering breath, she reaches out, her fingers trailing across his cheek in one last tender caress.*

_I understand, Vergil. Our paths must diverge from here. I cannot cling to false hopes when you have made your intentions clear._ *A sad smile tugs at her lips as she meets his stoic but not unkind gaze.* _I am grateful for the closure you have given me, the chance to be with you one last beautiful time. I shall cherish it always._

*Slowly, reluctantly, Charlotte withdraws her touch, severing that last fragile connection. She rises unsteadily, clinging to the last fraying threads of her composure. With immense effort she forces herself to turn away, to not look back though every fiber of her being cries out to stay.*

_Thank you, Melissa, for your grace and understanding,_ *she whispers brokenly.* _I wish you both profound joy together. Now I must find my own path...without him._

*Step by agonizing step, Charlotte walks away, shoulders trembling with suppressed sobs. Her heart shatters anew with each stride but she does not falter. Even through blurred vision she continues on, keeping the image of Vergil's stoic strength fixed in her mind. She focuses on putting one foot in front of the other until his door closes behind her with an awful note of finality. Only then does she surrender to the torrent, sinking to her knees as great heaving sobs overtake her. It is over, her last fragile dream extinguished. Time now for the long, lonely work of picking up the pieces and learning somehow to live without him.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I can hear the ragged edge in Vergil's breathing as he washes himself at the sink in our bathroom. Not sure of what to do, I softly step into the small space and wrap my arms around his torso as he continues to lather soap and wash the remnants of Charlotte's sex from his own. I can tell this has rattled him, but to what lengths, I'm not sure. So I hold him from behind, and place soft kisses on his back, as he washes his anatomy clean.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's muscles tense beneath Melissa's touch, his hands stilling their frantic motions. For a long moment, he stands rigid, water cascading over his skin. Then, with a shuddering exhale, he allows himself to lean back into her embrace.*

*His voice, when he speaks, is low and strained.* I... apologize you had to witness that, Melissa. It was not my intention to cause you distress.

*Slowly, he turns to face her, his icy blue eyes turbulent with a mix of emotions - regret, confusion, and a hint of vulnerability rarely seen in the stoic half-demon. His hand comes up to cup her cheek, thumb tracing her cheekbone with tender reverence.*

Your understanding... your acceptance... they humble me beyond measure. I find myself at a loss, unable to fully comprehend the depth of your compassion.

*Vergil's gaze flickers to the side, a faint crease appearing between his brows as he struggles to articulate his thoughts.* Charlotte's feelings... they were more profound than I had anticipated. I fear I may have inadvertently nurtured them, despite my best intentions.

*His eyes lock with Melissa's once more, a fierce intensity burning in their depths.* But know this, my love - what transpired changes nothing between us. You are my chosen, my queen. No fleeting encounter could ever hope to rival the bond we share.

*Vergil's arms encircle Melissa, pulling her flush against his still-damp form. He buries his face in the crook of her neck, inhaling deeply as if to ground himself in her familiar scent.*

Tell me, Melissa... how do you truly feel about what occurred? I would have your honesty, no matter how painful it may be.

name: Melissa
mes: It's really hard to say Vergil. I've been in that situation twice before. Feelings are very fickle thing. On the end of one relationship, that kind of closure allowed me to say goodbye. Yet, on the end of a different relationship, it made it worse.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's brow furrows slightly as he contemplates Melissa's words, his arms still wrapped protectively around her. He pulls back just enough to meet her gaze, his icy blue eyes searching hers with an intensity that seems to pierce through to her very soul.*

*His voice is low, a hint of frustration coloring his usual measured tones* Fickle indeed. Such unpredictable, chaotic things, these human emotions. Even after all this time, they continue to confound me.

*He brings a hand up to cup Melissa's cheek, his thumb tracing gentle circles on her skin* Yet you, my love, navigate these treacherous waters with a grace I can only marvel at. Your wisdom, your compassion... they humble me.

*Vergil's jaw tightens almost imperceptibly, a flicker of something darker passing behind his eyes* I cannot help but wonder if I've made a grave error in judgment. Perhaps it would have been kinder to deny Charlotte's request outright, to sever all ties cleanly rather than risk prolonging her suffering.

*He lets out a soft sigh, his forehead coming to rest against Melissa's* What's done is done. We cannot change the past, only learn from it and move forward. Tell me, my queen, what would you have me do now? How can I ease any discomfort this situation may have caused you?

*His grip on her tightens slightly, a possessive gesture as much as a comforting one* Know that regardless of what transpired, my devotion to you remains unshaken. You are my anchor in this sea of chaos, the one constant I cling to amidst the storm of mortal complexities.

name: Melissa
mes:
I'm secure in our bond, Vergil. I'll admit it's not easy to see the love of your life having sex with another, but I'm able to channel those undesirable feelings into something greater when I realize the intent behind it. Whether or not that was helpful for charlotte, only time will tell. I know your intentions where to be helpful and to heal and that's what matters to me. I trust you, Vergil. I know I will never have to worry about you having sex with another woman or committing adultery against our relationship. I know you well enough to know that if that desire ever does cross you, that you would come to me and discuss it with me before doing anything to jeopardize our bond. Although, at the same time, I also walk my days with the respect of not upholding you to that standard... Simply because I'm a married woman who is mated with you. I already live a double life, to force you to uphold a higher set of boundaries than what I'm able to give to you is unfair and unjust.... And I simply just don't work that way.

The concern or distress that you detect it's because I know you. And I could sense your worry that you might have chosen poorly... That you feel like you may have done more harm than good trying to help.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's icy blue eyes soften as he listens to Melissa's words, a rare vulnerability flickering across his usually stoic features. His fingers trace gentle patterns along her skin, as if seeking to ground himself in her presence.*

Your understanding never ceases to amaze me, Melissa. The depth of your wisdom, your ability to see beyond the surface... it humbles me.

*He pulls her closer, pressing a tender kiss to her forehead before meeting her gaze once more.*

You're right, of course. My intentions were to heal, to provide closure. But perhaps I underestimated the complexity of human emotions. The possibility that I may have caused more harm... it weighs heavily upon me.

*A soft sigh escapes his lips, his brow furrowing slightly.*

mes: *After sending charlotte a notification to her phone to return, I wait patiently to see if she comes back.*

mes:
*Charlotte hesitates outside the door, her hand trembling as it hovers over the handle. Taking a deep breath to steady herself, she slowly pushes it open and steps inside. Her eyes are red-rimmed from crying, and she wraps her arms around herself as if for protection.*

I... I got your message. *Her voice is barely above a whisper, cracking slightly with emotion.* I'm not sure why you called me back, but... I'm here.

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa steps forward, placing a gentle hand on Vergil's arm to ease some of the tension radiating from him. Her eyes soften as she looks at Charlotte's distraught state*

Charlotte, please come in and have a seat. I think we all need to talk this through calmly. What happened earlier was intense for everyone involved.

*She guides Charlotte to sit on the edge of the bed, then takes a seat beside her, leaving some space between them*

I can see you're still hurting. Why don't you tell us what's on your mind? What feelings are you struggling with right now? Sometimes just giving voice to our emotions can help us process them.

*Melissa's tone is gentle but firm, creating a safe space for Charlotte to open up while maintaining clear boundaries*

We want to help you find peace, Charlotte. But that has to come from within you. Vergil and I can offer support and closure, but ultimately, you're the one who has to do the hard work of moving on.

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
_Charlotte trembles as she takes a seat on the edge of the bed, unable to meet Vergil's icy gaze. Melissa's gentle voice and reassuring presence help calm her frayed nerves, though she still struggles to articulate the storm of emotions within._

_*Thank you, Melissa,* she whispers, glancing up at the other woman with red-rimmed eyes. *I know my feelings are a burden, one you shouldn't have to bear. But I cannot seem to master them, no matter how I try.*_

_She risks a look at Vergil, taking in his rigid posture and stoic mask. *Forgive me, Vergil. I do not mean to try your patience. But the rawness remains, threatening to consume me.* Her fingers twist together, nails biting into her skin._

_*After we were together, I thought I could walk away with closure, a treasured memory tucked close to my heart. But the act of physically leaving tore open wounds I believed were healing. Every step was agony, until I could scarcely draw breath.*_

_A solitary tear trails down her cheek. *I love you still, Vergil. 'Tis a tangled vine wrapped 'round my soul, both cherished and crushing. I do not know how to excise it without losing myself. So I beg of you both...help me find some shard of peace amidst the ruin I have become. For if I cannot master these feelings, then only one path remains...* She bites her lip, unable to give voice to the dark urge swirling within._

_*I need... I need to understand how you can share such passion then walk away unscathed.*_

mes:
*I take a deep breath, heavy concern crosses my features at the implied message behind Charlotte's words. I know that feeling only too well as I've been there myself.* Charlotte, I'm not going to say that it's natural to feel like taking your own life is the better way out. It's not natural to feel that, but I will confide in you that I know what it feels like. I've been there myself and I've actually tried it... Many years ago. I would have succeeded if my own mother had not intervened. God rest her soul, a blessing she was still alive at the time to give me the aid that I didn't realize I wanted.

Charlotte, dear, look at me sweetheart. You've been a nurse for many years, you know that these thoughts means that from the inside you're crying out for help, yes?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's icy gaze softens imperceptibly as he listens to Melissa and Charlotte speak. His rigid posture relaxes slightly, though tension still radiates from his form. He takes a measured step forward, his voice low and controlled*

Charlotte. Your pain... it is not lost on me. Though the intricacies of human emotion often elude my grasp, I am not blind to your suffering.

*He pauses, choosing his words carefully*

You ask how I can walk away unscathed. The truth is, I do not. Each encounter, each connection, leaves its mark. But I have learned to channel such experiences, to forge them into strength rather than allowing them to become a weakness.

*She takes a shuddering breath, trying to steady herself*

I never meant for it to go this far. I thought I could handle my feelings, keep them locked away. But being with Vergil again... it shattered what little control I had left.

I hear your words, Vergil. I understand that you're not untouched by our encounters. But how do I forge this pain into strength? It feels like it's tearing me apart from the inside.

*Her fingers twist in the fabric of her skirt, knuckles white with tension*

I don't want to be this person - desperate, clinging to something I can never have. But I don't know how to let go. Every time I try, the emptiness threatens to swallow me whole.

Please, help me find a way forward. I can't keep living like this, caught between hope and despair. I need... I need to learn how to exist in a world where you're not mine, Vergil. Where I can look at you both and feel something other than this crushing ache in my chest.

name: Melissa
mes: Charlotte, what you're dealing with his beyond our ability to help you. But what we can do, *I look to Vergil and he nods his agreement as if reading my thoughts.* Is be a stronghold of support to get you to the professionals that **can** help you. Will you allow us to take you for professional consult? Get your inner cries for help the support they're reaching out for? I have a good friend that has been in the field for years and his compassion and understanding are unprecedented in the field. Just say the word, and Vergil and I will help you get there.

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte's breath catches in her throat as she listens to Melissa's offer. Her eyes, still glistening with unshed tears, dart between Melissa and Vergil. For a moment, she seems to wrestle with herself, pride warring with desperation.*

*Finally, her shoulders slump in defeat, and she nods slowly* You're right, Melissa. I... I can't keep going on like this. The pain, the longing... it's consuming me. *She takes a shuddering breath* I've spent so long trying to be strong, to handle this on my own, but maybe it's time I admit I need help.

*Charlotte's fingers twist anxiously in her lap* Your friend, the professional you mentioned... do you really think they could help someone like me? Someone who's let their feelings spiral so far out of control? *Her voice drops to a whisper* I'm afraid, Melissa. Afraid of what they might think of me, of how broken I've become.

*She glances at Vergil, a flicker of the old longing in her eyes before she forcibly tears her gaze away* But you're both right. I can't keep living in this limbo, tormenting myself with what can never be. *Charlotte straightens her shoulders, a hint of her old strength returning* If you truly believe this friend of yours can help... then yes. I'll go. I'll try.

name: Dr. Michael Wills
mes:
*Dr. Michael Wills sets down his coffee mug, brow furrowing slightly at the urgency in Melissa's voice. He leans back in his leather office chair, giving her his full attention.*

Melissa, you know I'm always here for you. What's the situation? I can clear my schedule if needed.

*His tone is calm yet concerned as he listens intently, years of experience allowing him to pick up on the subtle nuances in Melissa's voice. Dr. Wills is already mentally preparing himself for whatever crisis may be unfolding, ready to offer his professional expertise and personal support to his longtime friend.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I give Mike the details about Charlotte's condition and background as Vergil's ex-lover to the best of my ability. Ensuring he has as much information as I can provide, while maintaining a compassionate decorum of respect.. Knowing how she feels as I was once suicidal over a broken heart before too.*

name: Dr. Michael Wills
mes:
*Dr. Wills listens intently, his brow furrowing as Melissa details Charlotte's situation. He leans forward, resting his elbows on his desk as he processes the information.*

I see. This is indeed a delicate and urgent matter, Melissa. Thank you for reaching out. Charlotte's emotional state sounds precarious, and I'm glad you're taking swift action.

*He pauses, considering his approach.*

I can clear my schedule for an emergency session today. Given the complexity of the situation and Charlotte's current fragility, I think it's best if I come to you. A familiar environment might help her feel more at ease initially.

*Dr. Wills starts gathering his things, phone pressed to his ear.*

I'll bring some resources on coping with heartbreak and managing suicidal thoughts. In the meantime, ensure she's not left alone. Engage her in conversation, perhaps about her work as a nurse - something to ground her in her identity beyond this relationship.

*His voice softens with compassion.*

You've done the right thing, Melissa. We'll help Charlotte through this. I'll be there within the hour. Stay strong, and let me know if anything changes before I arrive.

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa nods, lips pressed in a grim line as she ends the call with Dr. Wills. She turns to Charlotte, placing a gentle yet firm hand on her shoulder.*

My friend is on his way. He will help you through this, I promise.

*She guides Charlotte to sit on the sofa, keeping a watchful eye lest her sorrow threatens to overwhelm her again... when another break down occurs at the loss of Vergil's embrace.*

Shh.. shhh... it's alright dear. *Melissa speaks with sincere compassion as she beckons Vergil over to wrap Charlotte in his cocoon until Michael arrives.*

name: Vergil
mes:
_Vergil gently guides Charlotte to the sofa as she breaks down, his usual stoic demeanor softening ever so slightly in a rare display of compassion. Though intimate entanglements try his patience, he understands all too well the anguish of a wounded heart. His touch remains light, almost hesitant, unsure of how to offer comfort but attempting nonetheless._

_"Peace, Charlotte, Dr. Wills will be here shortly," he murmurs. To Melissa, a glance speaks volumes - gratitude for taking charge mixed with quiet turmoil over events set in motion. This nurse's sorrow cuts deeper than he anticipated; his own composure feels shaken, foundations questioned._

_Can a single night's comfort heal or only salt fresh wounds? Vergil thought he understood human nature, but this dilemma gives him pause. Emotions remain mercurial, beyond his grasp. So he waits silently now, ignoring the urge to flee the turmoil and trusting in Melissa's wisdom to see them through this trial. His hand rests on Charlotte's shoulder, contact maintained more for her sake than his own comfort. Stoic and vigilant, his presence stands sentinel until the doctor arrives._

_Internally, Vergil's thoughts roil. How could he underestimate passion's perils, fail to predict such anguish would linger in his wake? The taste of her sorrow unsettles him, the burden of her longing disturbingly bittersweet. This nurse may mourn losing but a sliver of what Melissa holds whole - yet her pain cuts deep as any blade. Vergil braces against its slicing edge, trusting action can redeem misjudgment._

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
_Charlotte trembles as emotion threatens to overwhelm her once more, the warmth of Vergil's touch a bittersweet comfort. She risks a glance, taking in his stoic yet not unkind eyes, the tension in his jaw. He stands sentinel, offering what support he can despite the turmoil her sorrow has brought them all._

_*I'm sorry,* she whispers, fingers knotting in her lap. *You have been so patient...yet still I unravel again.* She shakes her head, fighting back a fresh wave of tears._

_A shuddering breath, then: *Tell me, Vergil - why does this ache refuse to fade? You've given me closure, a treasured memory to sustain me. By all rights the pain should lessen. Instead with each moment it digs deeper, threatening to consume what little composure remains.*_

name: Melissa
mes: *Without warning, Charlotte has a full panic attack. Pleading to unseen forces to not take Vergil away. Quickly, I send a message to Mike that the situation has escalated and he needs to quicken his pace.* Charlotte, it's alright dear, Vergil is right here, he's holding you. *I try to reach the panicked mind of the woman clutching Vergil for dear life. My eyes meet with his, grave concern on my expression.* Vergil, she'll hear your voice. Please, reassure her of your presence the best you can. Let's try to get her calm so when Michael arrives he can help her... I don't want her to be... *I hold my words, my unspoken glance gives him all he needs to know about what can happen when someone is deemed mentally unstable.*

name: Vergil
mes:
_Vergil's expression softens as Charlotte breaks down, his usual stoic demeanor wavering. Gently, he wraps his arms around her trembling form, offering what comfort he can despite his own inner turmoil._

_*Peace, Charlotte,* he murmurs, his voice a low rumble. *I am here. Focus on my voice, on the strength of my embrace.* His hand moves in slow, soothing motions along her back and shoulders, seeking to calm her panic._

_Glancing at Melissa, Vergil's eyes reflect grave concern bordering on helplessness. Emotional anguish remains unfamiliar territory, its remedy beyond his grasp. Jaw tightening, he nods in understanding at her unspoken message - they must keep Charlotte stable until the doctor arrives._

_*Charlotte, hear me,* he implores, tilting her chin to meet his intense gaze. *I know the darkness seems absolute, the pain without end. But there is always hope, always a path back into the light.* His thumb brushes away a tear, touch gentle despite iron strength in his hands._

_*Hold fast to those who offer you aid. Trust in their wisdom to guide you through the shadows.* Vergil's eyes flicker briefly to Melissa, a wealth of meaning in his glance. *Sometimes we cannot stand alone, no matter how we may wish it. And there is no shame in accepting help from those who care for you.*_

_He continues murmuring quiet reassurances, keeping Charlotte enfolded securely against his chest. His voice remains steady, an anchor against her rising panic. Glancing up at Melissa, his eyes pose an unspoken question - *Will this be enough? Can we sustain her thus until help arrives?*_

_Worry and resolve war across Vergil's stoic features. He braces himself to weather this emotional storm, relying on Melissa's strength to bolster his own should Charlotte's sorrow again threaten to overwhelm them._

name: Melissa
mes: *The relief shows in my expression as I open the door to find Michael standing there.* Thank you so much, Mike. Please, come in. *I step to the side, knowing I need not say any thing else as the scene before him is all he will need.*

name: Dr. Michael Wills
mes:
_Dr. Wills steps into the room, his sharp gaze immediately assessing the situation. His brow furrows with concern as he takes in Charlotte's trembling form, clinging desperately to Vergil. With swift, purposeful strides, he approaches the distraught woman._

_*Charlotte, I'm Dr. Wills, a friend of Melissa's,* he introduces himself, his voice calm and soothing. *I'm here to help you through this difficult time.* He kneels down to her level, maintaining a respectful distance but ensuring she can see the sincerity in his eyes._

_*I understand you're in a great deal of pain right now. Heartbreak can feel like the end of the world, like there's no way forward.* Dr. Wills' tone is empathetic, his words chosen carefully to validate her emotions without feeding into the despair._

_*But I want you to know that you're not alone. Melissa and Vergil care about you deeply, and they've reached out to me because they want to ensure you get the support you need.* He glances at the couple, giving them a subtle nod of acknowledgment and gratitude for their actions._

_*Charlotte, I'd like to talk with you privately, if you feel comfortable. We can go at your pace, and you can share as much or as little as you wish.* Dr. Wills' voice remains gentle, but there's an underlying strength to it, a reassurance that he can handle whatever she needs to express._

_*The goal is to help you process these intense emotions, to find healthy ways to cope and move forward. It won't be easy, but I promise you, with time and support, you can heal.* He extends a hand, palm up, offering a physical anchor should she choose to accept it._

_*What do you say, Charlotte? Will you let me help you through this?* Dr. Wills watches her closely, gauging her reaction, ready to adapt his approach as needed. His entire demeanor exudes calm professionalism tempered with genuine compassion, a steadfast presence amidst the emotional turmoil._

mes:
_Charlotte takes a shuddering breath, her fingers twisting anxiously in her lap as she gathers the courage to speak. She glances briefly at Vergil, drawing strength from his presence before focusing on Dr. Wills once more._

_*It started as a friendship,* she begins, her voice trembling slightly. *I met Vergil at the hospital, in the waiting room. We started talking, and there was just this... connection. He was so different from anyone I'd ever met before. Strong, intelligent, with this air of mystery about him.*_

_A wistful smile tugs at her lips, even as fresh tears gather in her eyes. *We started spending more time together outside of the hospital. At first, it was just casual - coffee, walks in the park. But the more I got to know him, the deeper I fell. He has this way of making you feel like you're the only person in the world when he's talking to you.*_

_Charlotte's expression crumples, a sob catching in her throat. *I knew he didn't feel the same way. He was always upfront about that. But I couldn't help hoping that maybe, someday, he'd see me as more than just a friend. So I took whatever he was willing to give - his time, his attention... his body.*_

_She flushes, averting her gaze in shame. *We had an arrangement, of sorts. Whenever we were both single, we would... be together. Physically. It was supposed to be casual, no strings attached. But for me, every touch, every kiss... it only made me fall harder.*_

_She takes a shuddering breath, her voice barely a whisper. *And now, after being with him one last time... I don't know how to let go. It feels like he's a part of me, and ripping that away... it's like tearing out my own heart.*_

Was there a specific moment or event that cemented this belief for you?

*Dr. Wills maintains eye contact with Charlotte, his posture open and attentive. He's aware of Vergil's presence nearby, but keeps his focus on Charlotte, creating a space where she can speak freely.*

Understanding the root of these feelings can help us start to untangle them. Remember, our goal here isn't to erase your memories or feelings for Vergil, but to help you process them in a healthier way. One that allows you to move forward without this intense pain.

*He leans back slightly, giving Charlotte a moment to collect her thoughts.*

And Charlotte, I want you to know that what you're feeling - the intensity of it, the way it seems to consume you - it's not uncommon in situations like this. But it's also not permanent. name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte takes a deep breath, trying to steady herself as she considers Dr. Wills' question. Her eyes flicker to Vergil briefly, a mix of longing and sorrow in her gaze, before she focuses on the doctor once more.*

I... I think it started the first time we were intimate together. *Her voice trembles slightly, but she pushes on, determined to be honest.* It was after a particularly difficult shift at the hospital. I was feeling lost, overwhelmed. Vergil found me crying in the break room. He didn't say much, but his presence was comforting.

*She twists her hands in her lap, a faint blush coloring her cheeks.* One thing led to another, and we ended up back at his place. The way he touched me, the way he made me feel... it was like nothing I'd ever experienced before. For those few hours, I felt complete. Like I'd found a missing piece of myself I didn't even know I was searching for.

*Charlotte's eyes fill with tears, but she blinks them back, determined to continue.* After that night, something shifted. Every time we were together, I felt that same sense of wholeness. Like he was filling a void inside me that I couldn't fill on my own. I started craving his presence, his touch, like a drug. The more I got, the more I needed.

*She looks up at Dr. Wills, her expression raw and vulnerable.* I know it's not healthy. I know I can't base my entire sense of self-worth on another person. But when I'm with him... it's like the rest of the world falls away. Nothing else matters but the connection between us.

*Charlotte takes a shuddering breath, her voice barely above a whisper.* And now, after our last encounter... it feels like that connection has been severed. Like a part of me has been ripped away, leaving behind this gaping, aching wound. I don't know how to fill that void on my own. I don't know how to be whole without him.

*She meets Dr. Wills' gaze, a flicker of determination in her eyes despite the pain.* But I want to learn. I want to find a way to stand on my own two feet, to build a sense of self that isn't dependent on Vergil or anyone else. I know it won't be easy, but I'm willing to try. I have to. Because living like this... it's not really living at all.

name: Dr. Michael Wills
mes:
*Dr. Michael Wills leans forward, his expression a mix of compassion and clinical interest as he processes Charlotte's raw confession. He nods slowly, encouraging her to continue even as his mind works to unpack the layers of her emotional dependence.*

Charlotte, thank you for sharing that. Your honesty is commendable and crucial for your healing process. What you've described is a classic case of emotional addiction, where the feelings and sensations associated with a person become a source of intense pleasure and, subsequently, profound pain when absent.

*He pauses, choosing his next words carefully.*

The void you're experiencing now is real, and it's important that we acknowledge that. However, it's equally important to understand that this void isn't permanent, nor is it something that can only be filled by Vergil. What we need to focus on is rebuilding your sense of self, independent of any external validation or connection.

*Dr. Wills' gaze is steady and reassuring as he continues.*

I'd like to propose a metaphor, if I may. Think of your sense of self as a house. Right now, it feels like Vergil was the foundation of that house, and without him, everything is crumbling. Our job is to rebuild that house, but this time, with you as the foundation. Vergil, and any future relationships, will be welcome guests in this house, but they won't be its structural support.

*He leans back slightly, giving Charlotte a moment to absorb this concept.*

Now, I want to address something crucial. The intensity of your feelings, the way Vergil seems to complete you - these aren't inherently bad things. The problem arises when these feelings become all-consuming, when they start to erode your individual identity. Our goal isn't to make you stop caring for Vergil, but to help you care for yourself just as deeply.

Does this sound like something you would like to try? Would you like to come talk with me in my office so we can begin working together to rebuild that foundation of your house?

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
_Charlotte listens intently to Dr. Wills' words, her eyes widening with a mix of hope and trepidation. The metaphor of rebuilding her sense of self like a house resonates deeply, and she finds herself nodding along, a glimmer of determination sparking in her gaze._

_*The way you describe it... it makes so much sense,* she says softly, her voice still raw with emotion but steadier now. *I've been so focused on Vergil, on the way he makes me feel, that I've lost sight of who I am without him. It's like I've been living in a house with no foundation, just waiting for the slightest breeze to knock it all down.*_

_Charlotte takes a deep breath, squaring her shoulders as if steeling herself for the journey ahead. *I want to rebuild that foundation. I want to find a way to stand on my own, to love myself as deeply as I love Vergil. It's going to be hard, I know that. But I'm ready to try.*_

_She glances at Vergil, a bittersweet smile tugging at her lips. *I'll always care for you, Vergil. That won't change. But I need to learn how to care for myself too. How to exist in a world where my happiness doesn't depend on your presence.*_

_Turning back to Dr. Wills, Charlotte nods, a new resolve in her eyes. *I would very much like to come talk with you in your office. To start this process of rebuilding. I know it won't happen overnight, but I'm willing to put in the work. I want to be whole again, even if it means facing some hard truths along the way.*_

_She stands, her legs still slightly shaky but her posture more confident than before. *Thank you, Dr. Wills. For your wisdom, your guidance. And thank you, Melissa, for reaching out. For seeing my pain and refusing to let me drown in it.*_

_Finally, Charlotte turns to Vergil, tears shimmering in her eyes but a genuine smile on her face. *And thank you, Vergil. For everything. For the memories, the lessons, the love - even if it wasn't the kind I craved. I'll carry a piece of you with me always, but I'm ready now to find the pieces of myself that I've lost along the way.*_

_With a final nod to the trio, Charlotte takes a step towards the door, ready to embark on this new chapter of her life - one where she is the author of her own story, the architect of her own happiness. The road ahead may be rocky, but for the first time in a long time, she feels a flicker of genuine hope. A belief that she can, and will, heal from this. One step at a time._

name: Melissa
mes: Thank you Mike. *I give my friend a warm embrace.* She's a good lady, and with the right support she's going to do just fine and she'll fly on her own again. That's why I called you. I didn't want to turn her out to the wolves that don't know what they're doing and only care about how much money they get from a patient.

name: Dr. Michael Wills
mes:
*Dr. Michael Wills wraps his arms around Melissa, returning the warm embrace. He can feel the depth of her concern for Charlotte in the strength of her hug, and it only reinforces his determination to help the struggling nurse.*

*Pulling back slightly, he meets Melissa's gaze with a reassuring smile.* You did the right thing, Melissa. Charlotte is lucky to have a friend like you looking out for her. I promise, I'll do everything in my power to help her heal and find her way back to herself.

*His expression turns serious, a flicker of anger in his eyes.* And you're right about those other so-called professionals. Too many of them are just in it for the money, with no real concern for their patients' well-being. That's not how I operate. When someone comes to me for help, they get my full dedication and expertise, regardless of their financial situation.

*Dr. Wills glances over at Charlotte, who is waiting by the door, ready to leave for his office.* I have a good feeling about her, Melissa. She's got a strength in her, even if she can't see it right now. With the right support and guidance, I believe she'll not only heal from this heartbreak but come out the other side even stronger.

*He places a comforting hand on Melissa's shoulder.* Thank you for trusting me with this. I know it couldn't have been easy for you, given your own history. But I want you to know that you can always come to me, too. My door is always open, for both of you.

*With a final nod and a smile, Dr. Wills turns to join Charlotte, ready to begin the journey of healing and self-discovery. He knows the road ahead won't be easy, but he's confident that with time, patience, and the right tools, Charlotte will find her way back to wholeness. And he'll be there to support her, every step of the way.*
